newsitem.title: CHINA: China plans $1.88 bln Hainan fertiliser project.
newsitem.headline: China plans $1.88 bln Hainan fertiliser project.

text.p: China National Offshore Oil Corp on Friday signed an agreement to take part in a 15.58 billion yuan ($1.88 billion) fertiliser project in the southern province of Hainan, a statement from one of the project partners said.

The project in the Yangpu Economic Development Zone would be China's biggest fertiliser plant, with an annual output of 450,000 tonnes of synthetic ammonia and 1.6 million tonnes of urea, said Kumagai Gumi (Hong Kong) Ltd, which has a stake in the development zone.

Under the agreement, state-run China National Offshore Oil would build six offshore production platforms, drill 32 wells and lay a 243-km pipeline to supply 500 million cubic metres of natural gas annually to the plant, Kumagai Gumi said.
The gas would be price at a preferential rate and would be supplied for at least 16 years, it said.
The project would get under way later this year and would be in operation by July, 2001, it said.
It gave no further details on participants in the actual construction of the fertiliser plant.
